These two hours give youth access to services like a meal, showers, laundry, clothing, and sign-ups for case management & shelter. A youth medical clinic is held every Wednesday.
youthhygiene.Hygiene Hours: For food, laundry, showers, and more... Sun-Thurs 7-9pm

youthhygiene.Hygiene Name: Peace for the Streets by Kids from the Streets (PSKS)
youthhygiene.Hygiene Information: Drop-in center, clothing bank, computer center, community room and case management serving everyone. Visit in person. No fees.
Our drop-in center provides for basic and immediate needs of youth, including food, hygiene items, showers, clothing, and laundry. No fees.
Hospitality, advocacy, telephone use and resource referral information for people who are unemployed and/or homeless. No fees.

YouthCare has two drop-in locations from which homeless youth ages 13 to 24 can meet the basic needs of survival. YouthCare's Orion Center in Downtown Seattle is able to provide 3 meals a day, 5 days a week, along with showers, laundry services, and basic clothing, hygiene and first aid supplies. No fees.
youthhygiene.Hygiene Hours: Tuesday	8:30AM–5PM, Wednesday 8:30AM–6:30PM, Thursday 8:30AM–6:30PM, Friday	8:30AM–6:30PM, Saturday 11AM–1PM, Monday 8:30AM–6:30PM

youthhygiene.Hygiene Information: Lambert House is open to lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and questioning youth ages 11-22 for drop-in Monday through Friday from 4-9:30pm (see our calendar for holiday closures and breaks). . Lambert House empowers lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and questioning youth through the development of leadership, social, and life skills.. No fees.
